normalised: five G Rollout Gains Momentum Across India

unnormalised: New Delhi: The nationwide 5G rollout is accelerating, with Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel expanding their networks to cover more cities and towns. Jio announced yesterday that its 5G services, branded as "Jio True 5G," are now available in Agra, Uttar Pradesh, alongside ongoing expansion in metros like Mumbai and Delhi.
normalised: New Delhi: The nationwide five G rollout is accelerating, with Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel expanding their networks to cover more cities and towns. Jio announced yesterday that its five G services, branded as "Jio True five G," are now available in Agra, Uttar Pradesh, alongside ongoing expansion in metros like Mumbai and Delhi.

unnormalised: Bharti Airtel, under its “Airtel 5G Plus” banner, also reported significant progress, focusing on enhancing coverage in industrial zones like Pimpri-Chinchwad, Maharashtra. Industry analysts predict that by Diwali, on 24/10/2024, a substantial portion of urban India will have access to 5G connectivity.
normalised: Bharti Airtel, under its “Airtel five G Plus” banner, also reported significant progress, focusing on enhancing coverage in industrial zones like Pimpri-Chinchwad, Maharashtra. Industry analysts predict that by Diwali, on twenty fourth october two thousand and twenty four, a substantial portion of urban India will have access to five G connectivity.

unnormalised: The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) is closely monitoring the rollout to ensure quality of service and consumer protection. Concerns remain regarding rural connectivity and affordability, with TRAI scheduled to hold consultations on 17/08/2024 at 11:00 hrs to address these issues. Experts predict a potential boost to the Indian economy as a result of the technology, estimating investments reaching Rs. 3.5 lakh crore over the next three years, benefiting sectors ranging from agriculture to e-commerce. The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) is aiming for pan-India coverage by 15/08/2025. Approximately 50,000 km of optical fiber cable are being laid to support the enhanced bandwidth requirements.
normalised: The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (T R A I) is closely monitoring the rollout to ensure quality of service and consumer protection. Concerns remain regarding rural connectivity and affordability, with T R A I scheduled to hold consultations on seventeenth august two thousand and twenty four at eleven o’clock to address these issues. Experts predict a potential boost to the Indian economy as a result of the technology, estimating investments reaching rupees three point five lakh crore over the next three years, benefiting sectors ranging from agriculture to e-commerce. The Department of Telecommunications (D O T) is aiming for pan-India coverage by fifteenth august two thousand and twenty five. Approximately fifty thousand kilometer of optical fiber cable are being laid to support the enhanced bandwidth requirements.
